@ryanlawler yea that's true - there is more patience in general re: email but Slack can be patient as well depending on culture of org.
@ryanlawler my comments in response to people missing out of providing input or feeling like they have to be on all the time b/c of Slack.
@pmchiu backlash against slack and how it interrupts workflow and causes people to be left out of discussions.
The value of transparency, integrations, information organization, cross device ease of use and continued innovation far out weigh issues.
@ryanlawler @slack agreed. The platform still provides tremendous value for transparency and information organization that out weigh issues.
And building and sustaining a culture that respects quiet time both during work hours and during non-work time.
This same critique was hurled at email earlier as well. The core issue is building a culture that honors input from all prior to a decision.
All this backlash (#slacklash) against @slack is more telling of the corporate cultures of companies vs. issues re: the platform
